page.title: 03A Day in my Life.
page.content:
A Saturday. (cont.) It is normally cabbage pie. We don't have puddings. At 8.00pm I go to bed, at 8.30pm Mum reads me a story. It is called "Midnight is a Place", by Joan Aitken, then I read till 9.00pm. I am not a very good sleeper. I go to sleep at about 9.45pm. I normally dream about horses. By Katherine Cochrane, age 10
A Wednesday. It only takes a few minutes to get to school. I sit and chat to my friends until the bell goes at 9 am, then we sit down for the register. We line up for assembly, the recorder players get their recorders, a boy puts the record on and the juniors come in, closely followed by the infants. Mr Smith, our vicar, talks about Jesus and God,we sing a hymn and say our prayers.
